oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1940-03-02 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from March 2, 1940. Featuring David Stone (announcer), George D. Hay (host), and performers Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys, Uncle Dave Macon and son Dorris Macon, Ford Rush, Jack Shook and the Missouri Mountaineers, Napoleon 'Nap' Bastien, and Dee Simmons. Held at War Memorial Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Roy Acuff; Smoky Mountain Boys; Ford Rush; Uncle Dave Macon; Dorris Macon; Jack Shook; Missouri Mountaineers
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: [Unidentified song, test band] (excerpt) -- Opening statement (David Stone) -- Opening theme -- David Stone introduces George D. Hay -- George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys -- Whoa Mule (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys) -- George D. Hay introduces Ford Rush -- Lonesome Road (Ford Rush) -- Prince Albert commercial (David Stone, George D. Hay) -- George D. Hay introduces Uncle Dave Macon and Dorris Macon -- Old Dan Tucker (Uncle Dave Macon, Dorris Macon) -- George D. Hay introduces Jack Shook and the Missouri Mountaineers -- Wake Up Susan (Jack Shook and the Missouri Mountaineers) -- George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys -- Last Letter (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys) -- George D. Hay talks -- Running Wild (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys) [continued in part 2]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Hay, George D. (George Dewey), 1895-1968; Stone, David P., 1901-1995; Acuff, Roy; Smoky Mountain Boys; Rush, Ford, 1895-; Macon, Uncle Dave, 1870-1952; Macon, Dorris; Shook, Jack; Missouri Mountaineers (Musical group); McGar, Mac; Bastien, Napoleon; Simmons, Dee (Musician)
